content: How would I give @eholk access to rustbot? They're a member of wg-async-foundations and need to be able to apply AsyncAwait-* labels.
@tmandry could you file an issue on rust-lang/triagebot? We can adjust the code to permit that
Sure, I can file something. Though I'm also considering whether we want to give them special permission since they are leading the triage area of the working group.
Hm. Yeah, so for now, I think I'm going to just add another special case, like we do for wg-triage and wg-prioritization, for the whole wg-async-foundations
but eventually we'll want to do some thinking around the right model for this kind of thing -- potentially just labeling is not a restricted thing.
It may also make sense to just add the AsyncAwait-* labels to the unrestricted set which doesn't require permissions in triagebot.toml for the appropriate repositories
@tmandry do you think just allowing anyone to label is viable? If so, that seems like a slightly better option to me (with less "one more special case" feeling :)
I'm not opposed to allowing anyone to label AsyncAwait-polish
@eholk in particular also needs to be able to use AsyncAwait-triaged and, ideally, D-* labels
opening AsyncAwait-triaged up to anyone is not the end of the world, either. there's a slight risk it could interfere with our normal triage process if someone applied it by accident
D-* labels I think are world writable already
I'll just add wg-async-foundations to the exceptions list
should merge and deploy in ~30 minutes or so https://github.com/rust-lang/triagebot/pull/1510
